item.title: Former North Melbourne AFL player Phoenix Spicer dies aged 23
item.description: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

item.title: How artificial intelligence is being used across the ACT to provide vital services
item.description: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

item.title: Top End dams overflow as parks come to life in the wake of Cyclone Fina
item.description: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

item.title: Ashes 2026: Bad light halts England's charge as Harry Brook and Joe Root dominate spinless Aussie attack
item.description: The top two men's Test batters in the world make hay against a spinless Australian attack, only to be stopped by the weather.

item.title: Collector with 50 pinball machines in his shed hopes to create a playable museum
item.description: This shed in Western Australia is filled wall-to-wall with collectable pinball machines, all in working order. Greg Sharp hopes to one day share it as a playable pinball museum.

item.title: US makes 'bold' grab for oil as financial markets brace for price change
item.description: Oil futures do not trade until Monday, Australian time, and financial market participants are divided over whether there will be a spike or correction in the price of oil in Asian trade.

item.title: Evonne Goolagong Cawley's life story immortalised in screen drama
item.description: Lila McGuire on the pressure and joy of playing former world number one and winner of seven grand slam singles titles, tennis legend Evonne Goolagong Cawley.

item.title: Venezuelan diaspora divided over US capturing of leader Maduro
item.description: Venezuelan migrants across Latin America and other parts of the world cheered in the streets, supporting the US mission to capture Venezuela's deposed president, Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: SCG pays tribute to Bondi heroes, weather frustrates and Australia goes spinless — quick hits from day one of fifth Test
item.description: Australia opts not to pick a spinner for another Test, breaking a streak of 138 years at the SCG, which rises as one to honour the heroes of the Bondi terror attack. Here are the quick hits from the Ashes.

item.title: Weary Australia eyes Ashes finish line at the SCG as England senses opportunity
item.description: Only the rain could slow England's progress on day one in Sydney, as a weary Australia reflected its coach's claims the series really ended in Adelaide.

item.title: Australian cricket great Damien Martyn awakes from induced coma after falling ill with meningitis
item.description: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

item.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis tears up and Nick Kyrgios chills out as Special Ks return at Brisbane International
item.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

item.title: Venezuela updates: Maduro arrives at Manhattan court, Trump doubles down on oil plans for Venezuela - as it happened
item.description: Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife have been transferred to a New York courthouse as Donald Trump doubles down on oil plans for Venezuela — as it happened.

item.title: Death toll rises in Iran as anti-government protests spread
item.description: At least 16 people have been killed in a week of demonstrations fuelled by the rising cost of living.

item.title: Cookbook Club Naarm is bringing strangers together over food
item.description: Each month, strangers and friends meet to share dishes from a chosen cookbook. But Cookbook Club Naarm is more than a foodie feast, it's a reminder of food's power to bring us together.

item.description: What are you watching in 2026 when it comes to the economy or markets? That's the question we put to the ABC's experts.

item.title: Repeated brain injuries linked to memory changes in intimate partner violence survivors, study finds
item.description: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

item.title: Value of Australian dollar now dependent on interest rates, commodities prices and geopolitics
item.description: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

item.title: Were the US actions in Venezuela legal under international law?
item.description: International law is created by all states, not just the powerful few. This makes international community reactions to breaches particularly important.

item.title: National donor conception register would prevent 'potential trauma', advocate says
item.description: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

item.description: The Trump administration insists Venezuela's leaders will now comply with American demands after the extraordinary capture of president Nicolás Maduro — but his allies are resisting US pressure.

item.description: Daria Kasatkina admits she held back tears and dealt with severe nerves during an agonising three-set loss at the Brisbane International.

item.title: Emergency departments ill-suited for mental health crises, advocates say
item.description: A 24-year-old NSW border resident says dismissive treatment in hospitals, long waits for care and limited access to services have pushed her away from support.

item.description: As widespread flooding maintains its grip on north-west Queensland, thousands of livestock are reported missing or dead.

item.description: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

item.description: The team at Adelaide's City of Marion Libraries grows a legion of fans on social media and sees their videos go viral, clocking up millions of views.

item.title: Trump has no plan after removing Maduro, Schumer says, after 'troubling' classified briefing — as it happened
item.description: The Democrats' Senate leader, Chuck Schumer, says he has received a classified briefing from the White House on Donald Trump's plans for Venezuela — and is dismayed by the lack of detail.

item.title: Echidna population count underway in Queensland amid urbanisation and climate change fears
item.description: The lack of knowledge about the species has experts worried echidnas could decline without anyone noticing.

item.title: Police search for teenagers after machete attack in Caroline Springs park in Melbourne's west
item.description: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

item.title: Push for QVB's colourful glass to be made clear for more 'visibility' into stores
item.description: Dozens of people express opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

item.title: Australians trapped on Yemen's Socotra island after Saudi Arabia, UAE flare-up
item.description: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

item.title: Berry Street residential care staff fear being 'drug affected' at work due to high ice use
item.description: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

item.title: Half of Canberra's Commonwealth Avenue Bridge is closing for two years. Here's what you need to know
item.description: Commuters in Canberra are facing major disruptions as Commonwealth Avenue Bridge undergoes two years of major upgrades.

item.title: Gulf Country prepares for weeks of isolation, as north-east Qld coast braces for tropical low
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued a severe weather warning for the north Queensland coast as a tropical low approaches.

item.title: Fire on southern NSW property likely sparked by cigarette butt
item.description: A southern NSW landholder is urging smokers to think twice when disposing of their cigarette butts, after a grassfire razed her property.

item.title: Insurer Prosura hit by cyber data breach, customers contacted by 'threat actor'
item.description: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".

item.title: Ajla Tomljanović departs Brisbane International as Rinky Hijikata advances
item.description: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović loses a tense three-set match to world number 20 Karolína Muchová, while Rinky Hijikata is the last remaining local hope in the men's draw.

item.title: ASX closes marginally higher as inflation slows more than expected in November — as it happened
item.description: The CPI rose 3.4 per cent in the 12 months to November 2025, according to the latest ABS data, down from 3.8 per cent in October and below economists' expectations.

item.title: Outback NT hotel at centre of Peter Falconio mystery barred from serving alcohol
item.description: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

item.title: Kids at tiny school work to save extremely rare 'flying jewel' purple copper butterfly
item.description: It's the size of a 10-cent piece and matures under the guard of protective ants, but the purple copper butterfly needs more help to survive — and a group of NSW primary school students has stepped up to the challenge.

item.title: Ukraine's allies agree to security guarantees in 'significant step' towards ending Russia's invasion
item.description: At a key meeting in Paris, officials from Europe, Canada, the US and NATO say they will provide Kyiv's frontline forces with equipment and training, and back them up with air, land and sea support to deter any future Russian attack.

item.title: The tough balance of circumstance and support systems as WA woman faces eviction
item.description: As protesters strive to keep a woman from community housing eviction, the complexities of her situation collide with a housing provider's options.

item.title: Travellers urged not to rely solely on navigation systems for directions following recent strandings
item.description: A young couple got bogged on a remote dirt road in north Queensland and was forced to walk hours in search of help after trusting their navigation app to find a 24-hour fuel station.

item.title: Emergency warnings issued for Victorian fires as heatwave sweeps southern Australia — as it happened
item.description: Southern Australia is enduring its most intense heatwave in years, with temperatures set to soar from today until the weekend.

item.title: Students help teacher pop the question at remote WA school
item.description: Students at one of Western Australia's most remote schools help play a part in a special proposal for two of their teachers.

item.title: Ashes 2026: Jacob Bethell stars on day four, Beau Webster triple strike halts England momentum at SCG
item.description: England ends day four with a 119-run lead after a sparkling century to 22-year-old Jacob Bethell, with Beau Webster's late wickets halting the tourists' momentum.

item.title: Man denied bail over alleged Gold Coast bus stop attack that left man in intensive care
item.description: A 20-year-old has been denied bail after being charged with grievous bodily harm and attempted robbery following a New Year's Day incident on the Gold Coast that left another man in intensive care.

item.title: Mystery over safe with beef jerky inside recovered from Shark Bay's ocean floor
item.description: While hoping for treasure, a nervous Quoin Sellenger was left with a (sadly) inedible salty snack after retrieving a safe from the bottom of WA's Shark Bay.

item.title: Men charged over alleged international car theft syndicate targeting Toyota LandCruisers and Prados
item.description: Queensland Police say 60 Toyota LandCruisers and Prados were stolen across Brisbane between October 20 and December 1.

item.title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban are officially divorced
item.description: After 19 years as one of the entertainment world's most recognisable couples, actor Nicole Kidman and musician Keith Urban are officially divorced.

item.title: Perth Bears sign Bulldogs forward Josh Curran ahead of 2027 NRL entry
item.description: The Perth Bears land their most experienced NRL player so far in their recruitment drive, signing Canterbury's Josh Curran on a three-year deal.

item.title: Business as usual at Venezuela-Colombia border crossing
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: AI hallucinations and the dilemma of false or misleading information
item.description: When a journalist emails a company with questions looking for answers, the least they expect is a real person to feed them the spin, half-truths or outright lies. Not a machine.

item.title: Concerns children's personal details vulnerable to data breaches under NSW government's Digital Hub
item.description: NSW is rolling out a digital hub that centralises early childhood centres' information, but some are worried it could be vulnerable to data breaches.

item.title: Bayer's Monsanto sues Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna over mRNA technology
item.description: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

item.title: Alex de Minaur to miss Australia's Davis Cup tie against Ecuador in February
item.description: For the first time since making his debut in 2018, Alex de Minaur decides to sit out an Australian Davis Cup tie.

item.title: Inflation cools in November with consumer prices rising 3.4pc but still above the RBA's target
item.description: Inflation cooled in November, with the consumer price index rising 3.4 per cent over the year, down from 3.8 per cent a month earlier. Some economists continue to forecast a February rate hike, however.

item.title: Journalist says armed gangs patrolling Caracas
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Who is Nicolás Maduro Guerra, the son of Venezuela's deposed leader?
item.description: Nicolás Maduro Guerra rose through the ranks of his father's government and remains in Caracas. It's uncertain for how long.

item.title: Ben Stokes limps off during fourth day of final Ashes Test at SCG
item.description: Ben Stokes left the field during the first session of the fourth day at the SCG, with England confirming their skipper was being assessed for a right adductor injury.

item.title: Former Sydney detective Peter Meagher honoured in last Bondi terror attack funeral
item.description: A retired detective has been remembered as an "incredibly moral and honest man" at a funeral service three weeks after he was killed in the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Poland to face Australia in United Cup quarterfinals after Hubert Hurkacz wins singles against the Netherlands
item.description: Poland will meet the host nation in the last eight of the mixed-teams event after in-form Hubert Hurkacz beat Tallon Griekspoor of the Netherlands in Sydney.

item.title: How to protect yourself from heat-related illness as temperatures soar this week
item.description: Extreme heat forecast for the next few days has prompted warnings form health experts. Here's how to stay safe.

item.title: Past works reimagined in Second Look — Legacy, the Australian Design Centre's final exhibition
item.description: Second Look — Legacy celebrates sustainable making while paying homage to one of the most influential figures in Australia craft and design.

item.title: Truck crashes into five cars on Picton Road at Cataract, north of Wollongong
item.description: More than a dozen people were assessed by paramedics after a truck smashed into several cars on a major road north of Wollongong.

item.title: Melbourne tram enthusiasts join fight to save India's last tram network
item.description: Melbourne's iconic trams thrive in a car-centred world, but Asia's oldest tramway is now facing extinction.

item.title: Walwa fire
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Why does Trump want Greenland and why is it so important?
item.description: Donald Trump's continued interest in Greenland is part of his "America First" agenda to dominate the Western Hemisphere and contain China's interests in the region.

item.title: Council calls in diggers as big swells deposit masses of seaweed on Sydney beaches
item.description: Piles of kelp were removed from a popular Sydney beach, although some councils prefer to leave the seaweed for its environmental benefit.

item.title: Israel clears final hurdle to start settlement construction that would cut the West Bank in two
item.description: Critics say the E1 project would prevent the establishment of a contiguous Palestinian state.

item.title: Aboriginal artist Bobbi Lockyer in tears as Australia Post loses $4k painting
item.description: Indigenous artist Bobbi Lockyer has been left frustrated after she sent a $4,000 custom artwork of the Pilbara to a buyer in Queensland, only for an empty cardboard sleeve to be delivered.

item.title: Prisoners charged over death of Shannon Daniel Norgate to face court
item.description: Two men are set to face court over the alleged murder of another prisoner in a Queensland jail.

item.title: Heatwave conditions likely to bring increase of flies and maggots
item.description: Forecast heatwave conditions across large parts of the country could mean flies and maggots are more prevalent. Here's how to deal with them.

item.title: Kimberly Birrell, Olivia Gadecki, Emerson Jones suffer second-round losses at Brisbane International
item.description: Australian players Kimberly Birrell and Olivia Gadecki have fallen in the second round of the Brisbane International, along with rising star Emerson Jones, who went out after a high-quality encounter with the world number 17.

item.title: WA fishing ban sees fishers flock to coastal hamlet Windy Harbour
item.description: WA's new ban on demersal fishing sees fishers flock to a coastal hamlet unaffected by the new rules, but locals say the crowds are unsustainable.

item.title: Woman charged with attempted murder after allegedly stabbing man multiple times with steak knife
item.description: A 37-year-old woman has been charged with attempted murder after allegedly stabbing a man with a steak knife.

item.title: Songs from the Hottest 100 of 2005 that should have been higher
item.description: Arctic Monkeys were that low!? These are the tunes from triple j's Hottest 100 of 20. years ago that deserved to have placed higher.

item.title: Staff at new Noarlunga mental health unit 'visibly distressed and crying', union says
item.description: South Australia's doctors' union has raised concerns that clinicians were distressed when asked to admit more patients at a new mental health unit at Noarlunga Hospital when staffing levels were "not clinically safe".

item.title: Cosmetic nurse banned for two years after injecting botox without consulting doctor or obtaining prescription
item.description: An AHPRA investigation found Thia Sullivan injected a patient without doctor consultation or a script, falsified records, and urged patients not to co-operate with police.

item.title: Sam Welsford aiming to cap new Ineos-Grenadiers contract with National title in Perth
item.description: Sam Welsford, one of the drawcards at this week's Australian road cycling championships, has thanked fellow sprinter Caleb Ewan for advice on his new contract.

item.title: Ex-CIA agent Aldrich Ames who sold US secrets to the Soviets dies in prison at 84
item.description: Aldrich Ames, who was 84, betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in US history.

item.title: Beau Webster sparks another English meltdown and Jacob Bethell brings tears — quick hits from day four of the SCG Test
item.description: Beau Webster sparks a classic English meltdown as Jacob Bethell brings tears while Ben Stokes fails to finish another series. Here are your quick hits from day four of the SCG Test.

item.title: Wednesday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Ashes 2026: Jacob Bethell, England's biggest hope and biggest blunder, sets up Sydney finale
item.description: Jacob Bethell's brilliant maiden Test century sets up an intriguing finish in Sydney, but leaves everyone bemused as to where this precocious young player has been all summer.

item.title: Maida Vale, High Wycombe fire extinguished after closing parts of Roe Highway
item.description: Ground and aerial crews successfully control a bushfire that closed a section of Roe Highway and brought traffic to a standstill.

item.title: UK citizen described as 'good friend' by White Australia movement to be deported
item.description: A foreign national has his visa cancelled and is facing deportation from Australia, amid claims of links to the "White Australia" movement.

item.title: Nestlé recalls select batches of Alfamino infant formula
item.description: The precautionary measure is over concerns that the product could contain a toxin that can cause food poisoning symptoms.

item.title: Hottest day in years recorded across southern Australia as bushfire warnings remain
item.description: South-east Australia has sweltered through its hottest day in years as firefighters in Victoria continue to battle multiple out-of-control blazes.

item.title: Fresh probe for answers on missing woman in NT
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WA police respond to reports of man firing gun near Mullewa
item.description: Significant police resources are being deployed to the area after the gunman discharged the weapon, police say.
